snippet: The tally for Monday through Wednesday nearly matched the total for all of June, a rise in use of the synthetic drug that is alarming officials....
abstract: New York City officials issue warning to emergency rooms and other health care facilities after 130 people overdose on illegal synthetic drug K2 across city over three days; health and law enforcement officials blame recent overdoses on bad batch of drug, and not overall rise in use of drug.

byline.contributor: Rick Rojas and Eli Rosenberg contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The tally for Monday through Wednesday nearly matched the total for all of June, a rise in use of the synthetic drug that is alarming officials.

headline.main: K2 Overdoses Surge in New York: At Least 130 Cases This Week Alone
headline.print_headline: Surge in Overdoses From a Drug: 130 in Three Days
